(A) ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGANCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Evonik CYRO LLC is dedicated to protecting safety, health and the environment. Our commitment to protecting our employees and the communities that are home to our operations is an integral part of Evonik CYRO's way of doing business. Evonik CYRO has established safety, health, and emergency response and environmental policies and standards to meet or exceed all regulatory requirements. Evonik CYRO subscribes to the codes established for Responsible Care ®.



(B) THE WALLINGFORD PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED



Our facility manufactures acrylics that are used to make medical devices and other plastic products. The regulated substance used above threshold quantity is Acrylonitrile.



THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



Evonik CYRO's general accidental release prevention program includes:



EPA 40 CFR 68 - Risk Management Plans

EPA 40 CFR 63 Subpart H & Subpart FFFF National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants

OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 - Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals

OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 - Hazardous Waste Operations & Emergency Response

Other EPA, OSHA, DOT and State Regulations

Generally recognized & accepted engineering codes and standards and

Evonik CYRO and the Site Safety, Health, Environmental and Engineering standards



The following engineering and administrative controls help prevent release of Acrylonitrile:

- Operating procedures and attendance during transfer operations by trained personnel

- Locked transfer connections with verification of materials prior to loading/ unloading

- High level, temperature and pressure controls with alarms and/or automatic shutoffs

- Fire prevention programs include Nitrogen inerting of certain process vessels, grounding systems, electrical wiring and equipment rated for hazardous environments where necessary

- Distributed computer control

systems with uninterruptible power backup and independent safety and environmental alarms and/or interlocks

- Multiple level indicators and spill containment for storage tanks and production vessels

- 24 hour security guards and plant fire department presence

- Backup systems for process pneumatics, lighting, electrical power to certain process equipment, emergency cooling, process water, backup power for plant communications

- Fire extinguishing systems include water sprinklers, AFFF foam monitors, a Halon system, fire doors and fire valves on certain vessels

- Administrative controls include management of change procedures, mechanical integrity procedures, operating procedures, training programs for employees and contractors, contractor review procedures, pre-startup safety review procedures, process hazard review procedures, safety work permit procedures, hot work permit procedures and lockout/tagout procedures



(D) 5-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



May 30, 2014 at 11:45 AM there was an incident reported to the Connecticut Department of Environmental and Energy Protection, Oil & Chemical Spill Division on of release of <1 quart of AN while unloading a railcar, staff No. 205, case#2014-02593. There were no other incidents in the past 5 years.



(E) EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Wallingford Plant has an extensive emergency response program. This program includes actions to be taken by operating department, maintenance, utilities, office, technical, visitors, contractors, and plant emergency response employees. The onsite Fire Department drills periodically on various scenarios with the Town of Wallingford's Fire Department and is active in the Wallingford Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC). Drills with the Wallingford Fire Department are conducted and hands-on training (i.e. structural fire fighting) is periodically provided at the Town Fire Service Training area. In addition, CYRO Emergency Response teams help provide training in hazardous materials to

the Municipal Fire Department personnel.  An acrylonitrile exposure emergency response drill is conducted semiannually with the Wallingford Fire Department



(F) PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Evonik CYRO, LLC. is implements continuous improvement measures regularly to improve its processes, control technology, employee training, inspection, repair and maintenance of process equipment in order to improve safety.
